conversation.content: Um, hi, yeah, I'm calling about—*exhales*—claim denied? For my dog? I'm actually a vet tech myself so, uh, this is pretty ironic.
Oh, I see. Let me pull up your account... *inhales* okay, what's your policy number? Should start with PET and then some numbers.
Right, it's um, PET-7792-BK. Real quick—er, I know you're just doing your job here.

Thank you for that. I really appreciate it... So I'm looking at claim CLM-9982741-X here. For a torn ACL surgery? *exhales* And it shows... denied on November 3rd. Due to pre-existing condition classification.
Yeah but—*sharp inhale*—that's not right! Um, we just got him. Six months ago. No prior issues.
Right, I understand. So here's what I'm seeing... The denial code is E47-PRE. Which means. *sighs* They flagged something in his initial exam. From when you first enrolled him on May 15th?
But that was just—uh, routine stuff! Normal exam! I did it myself actually, er, at my clinic.

Hmm, okay so... Actually, wait. You said you're a vet tech? *inhales* That's interesting because... Let me check something else here. Sometimes when the policyholder works in veterinary services... The system flags things differently.
*exhales hard* Oh great. So um, being a vet tech hurts my case? That's—wow. Really appreciate that, guys.
No no, actually it might help... See, there's a form. VET-PROF-22A. For veterinary professionals disputing denials? Most people don't know about this. You'd need to submit it within 30 days though...
Wait really? Um, that's—thank you! Seriously! Er, how do I get that form?
So I can email it right now. To the address on file? *exhales* And between you and me... The system is ridiculous sometimes. A vet tech can't get coverage for their own dog? Come on.
*laughs* Right? Uh, yes please, email's perfect. God, thank you so much for this.
Sending now... Should arrive in about 5 minutes. Reference number REF-445821-VPA. And honestly? When you submit it... Mention your AVMA certification number. That usually helps.
Oh smart, yeah. Um, you're being incredibly helpful here. Like, er, really above and beyond.
Just doing what I can... *sighs* The form needs documentation though. Your original exam notes from May 15th? And any x-rays from before August 20th. If you have those...
Have them all! Digital files! Uh, perks of working at the clinic, right? *nervous laugh*

Perfect. So submit everything together... Use tracking code TRK-VET-903. And look. I've seen these approved in like 72 hours. When professionals submit them properly? The review team takes them seriously.
*exhales* Honestly? You just—um, saved my day. My week. Er, probably my bank account too.

Hey, I get it. Our pets are family... And the fact that someone who saves animals for a living. Can't get coverage for their own dog? *sighs* That's just wrong. Call back if you need anything. Ask for extension 4412. That's my direct line.

scenario: veterinary tech, upset that pet insurance denied coverage for her own dog
